website_summaries.verdict: A very sturdy baby gate with a latch that is complicated for kids to figure out, but still easy enough that parents can open it with one hand.
pros: You can add extensions for extra wide openings
Comes with 3 sizes of "spacers" to adjust to your opening
Tricky latch that will take older kids a while to figure out
Doesn't fall if leaned on or someone tries to crawl over
Company makes extra wide gate in several widths
cons: The doorway on this baby gate is a bit narrow and only swings 1 way

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.text: This was a waste of time. I have a 54 inch doorway that I needed a gate for. The spindle rods didn't reach far enough with one panel. I tried adding another panel but this that made the gate too wide. It seems like they need to go back and redisign the gate to fit all lengths up to 58 inches.
customer_reviews.author: JBo

customer_reviews.title: Great gate
customer_reviews.text: We have a wide door opening where we were intending to install this gate (46.5 inches), and I was sceptical about the stability. However, after the gate was installed and tightened, it is rock solid even when our athletic toddler sometimes tries to shake or pull it. I also used additional non-skid pads and I recommend getting them, as well as they increase the gate stability.
customer_reviews.author: Doberman

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: Very poor design On each four ends it has adjustable screw bolts to tighten so as to apply pressure against the wall Problem is that when you put pressure on the top ones it closes the gap to where the gate opens and closes, which will no longer open or close because it has pushed the opening to a smaller gap/opening. They really should have added a solid bar at the gate latch side to prevent that from happening, If they had done that you would be able to tighten it up against the wall surface. The directions left a lot to be desired, not very clear
customer_reviews.author: malibugal

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS BEFORE YOU BUY
customer_reviews.text: Regalo makes some good quality gates but this model is NOT one of them. This Model # 1158DS (56-in.) uses 5 individual sections that do NOT screw together. They are only held in place by the tension from each side. As a result, if you want to temporarily remove it, it will come apart into 5 sections. The gate locking design is also very bad. You have to squeeze the sides in enough to "close the gap" between the frame and the latch. Save your money. Installation and operation of this model is a nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as wide as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have a 58" opening (the max size listed) that I needed to block off, so I knew I was pushing it. When I set up the gate it was still easily an inch shy- and at least 4" shy of being sturdy. I love that I don't need to screw anything into the wall, but I needed to buy an extension panel anyway. I might've purchased a different product if I had known it wouldn't fit, but it wasn't worth the hassle of packing everything back up and returning it. The locking mechanism doesn't bother me, and in fact I can open it one-handed. If you have a not-too-wide opening, this is a great gate.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bracken

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: One of the pins on the 4" extension pieces was misaligned so I couldn't fit it on the gate. That made the gate completely unusable. Luckily, I had an extra extension piece from a previous baby gate package, so I was able to use that. I am extremely disappointed because I have bought several Regalo baby gates before and they worked well, but recently the quality of these products have been very poor. I just ordered and had to immediately return an extra wide Regalo baby gate because the welding on the door was broken. So this is the second order I have received that has been defective.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!!....move along folks....
customer_reviews.text: The latch or lock mechanism is way to loose. If you tighten the gate to keep it from falling (like a tug from a 1 year old), then the gate won't shut. If you adjust the latch to open and close smoothly....it is too loose on the wall. The latch should have a larger throw so it can be tightened to the wall securely. If you expand the gate with two of the extensions...it becomes flimsy. I think I'll stick with the old fashion wooden gates. I can't trust this device to keep my 1 year old from going down the stairs with the gate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gate. Even for bigger dogs this would work well. Keeps my two smaller dogs (yorkie & shin tzu) from the front door & gives me a little space when I need to get a package or let friends in. It gives you lots of sizing options and sets up very easily (less than 10 minutes) with no tools required. Nice metal construction, and the 2-phase lock is better than most gates I've seen. This gate is a very good value. I'd definitely buy another.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopperTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for the first week, and then it decided it was done. The gate works by pulling up a lever which makes a piece either extend, which locks the gate closed, or retracts, allowing it to swing open. The lever itself still works fine, but the connector no longer retracts, meaning we have to pull the lever up and manually force the connector to slide back. In essence, a one handed task now requires two, so you will need to put your child down each and every time you want to pass through the gate. The gate itself is sturdy. It's a shame they skimped on the materials that matter.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Best oversized height and length baby/pet gate I have found.
customer_reviews.text: The product was delivered in less than 24 hours after ordering and arrived undamaged and complete with every item advertised. The gate was made of quality metal materials and assembled within seconds after unboxing it. What made this product superior was the 29.5" base gate with 3 extension pieces for the perfect fit for my 52" kitchen opening (6", 8", and 12" extensions for a 58" maximum length, but the 4 adjustable pressure knobs can easily add another 4" of length) coupled with the 30" height made the perfect pet gate for our new Husky puppy. Extremely happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Strait

customer_reviews.title: Easy and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I love this gate because it fits a wide opening, is sturdy, and doesn't absolutely require holes in the wall. It says to screw in the wall cups, but I skipped that step. I used Wall Nanny things on the top (where I had room) and the Regalo cups on the bottom (sans screws). The only small problem I had was with pushing down the locking pin. I had to try some different positions (rotating it around). This is my second gate of this type. I bought it 14 years ago, used it for several years, and got rid of it. Now a few years later we need a gate again. I remembered the brand and found it in Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Greyt00

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly just doesn't work in the spaces... especially the 52" opening we have.
customer_reviews.text: The different gate parts of course fit together just so narrowly UNperfectly for us to install this any of the places we want to for our dog. It's now used at the bottom of our stairs with the small and medium addition because that was the only place it would sturdily installed.... because I had to rubber mallet hammer it in with the screws all the way in. I got it for a 52.5" opening, and it's soooo wobbly fitting that way. So that large gate addition part just sits in the basement purgatory for the foreseeable future. I wish I had more accurate measurements with the screws involved in the measurements.
customer_reviews.author: Juli Mixis

customer_reviews.title: This isn't pressure mounted. You must screw it into your wall to secure the door.
customer_reviews.text: When I read this, it said pressure mounted gate and I thought this would be perfect at the top of my stairs. I envisioned one side pressure mounted against the wall and the other side against my stair rail to keep my puppy out of the upstairs. But without screwing the sides into the wall to create enough tension, there isn't enough pressure allowing the gate to stay shut. I don't want to destroy the millwork of my banister so since the door won't stay shut at the top of the stairs, this is worthless. Please note, this item requires screwing into the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet and Sour

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Put up in about three minutes. Height was important when I was shopping for our gate, and something easy to open with one hand was mandatory. Keeps my JRT (a jumper) on his side of the house, and my feisty, fat alpha cat on the other. Our hallway is 37.5" wide, so we didn't need extra extensions. We didn't use the extra wall protectors, and I'm glad I didn't buy them because I haven't seen a single mark on my walls.
customer_reviews.author: wookielovin

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 59” wall space
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on a lot of reviews that said this would fit a 59” space. This does NOT fit a 59” space at all. I had to order a pack of 4” wall nanny extenders which will be here tomorrow. If you put it on a 59” wall, it will wobble and fall. It will NOT be tight and secure. I measured the space 3 times and I am positive my wall space is 59” wide. I don’t know what the other reviewers were measuring with but this absolutely does NOT work on a 59” space. You need either a wider gate, or you will need 4” wall nanny gate extensions.
customer_reviews.author: B. Riley

customer_reviews.title: Nice gate, good price, and fit my extra wide 48” doorway
customer_reviews.text: Nicely built. Seems pretty sturdy, but at 48” extended, it begins to flex a bit with small child pushing on it. Perfect for my lighter weight application. Easy to open with one hand, but does not auto latch on closing. Must make sure to latch the safety lock once closed. Latch is very secure and child resistant, with a sufficiently strong latch spring to deter little hands.
customer_reviews.author: v75rab

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but it works!
customer_reviews.text: Works for what we need it for. We added a bungie cord to pull the gate open when unlatched. Part of the base seems to be warped, so the gate doesn't quite line up correctly at the bottom, but it doesn't affect its use, just how it looks (and you can only notice when looking directly down). For install its important to note it's not just tension-- you have to screw little cups into the wall to hold the gate. It's not difficult but it will leave 4 holes. This does make it sturdier though. My 11 month old has already figured out how to open the latch so the locking mechanism is key!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Willis

customer_reviews.title: Simple, durable, solid, and easily functional
customer_reviews.text: This was a very simple and effective barrier between a living room and a stairway, preventing tumble injuries. Permanent mounting is the more secure choice, but I used the adjustable fit in order to prevent screw-in damage to our oak stairway post and nearby cabinet where this is placed. This has been in place for over 2 years, has remained solid, has a wide walk-through gate, and is left open when our granddaughter is not here. It has not fallen or failed, and is leaving no damage to the tension-fit surfaces. This is very worthwhile for safety, ease of use, durability, and tamper-free design that children have not unlocked.
customer_reviews.author: JimK

customer_reviews.title: Not long enough
customer_reviews.text: I measured my opening and it fit within the measurements when ordering this item. I ended up having to add a 2x4 on either wall in order to get the gate to juuuuuust make it across the opening. I'm sure it would be sturdier if I didn't have the 2x4s but I didn't want to bother with exchanging or returning the gate after waiting for it to arrive. We're just really careful when we open it. We use it to keep our small dogs from running into the front room/out the front door if someone comes over.
customer_reviews.author: Beana

customer_reviews.title: Not Overly Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Overall, okay, but I'd suggest looking at other products. Not impressed with this product. For reference, my installation was to the full 57 inch width. During the installation, I noted that the unit bowed because the bottom connections were loose. The top connections include a rod to stiffen them (one of them bent when I received the unit), but the lower ones don't include that feature. The lock requires action to close unlike other products that allow you to simply push the gate closed. Finally, unlike others, this gate doesn't have the ability to change whether the gate opens in or out after installation. Had I not waited two months to install the gate, I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: FrankR

customer_reviews.title: great gates so far
customer_reviews.text: I have two openings on my deck, one is 50" and the other is 55" wide. The gate worked perfectly for both. I had to ask my 10 yr old to hold the gate steady while I adjusted the pressure mounts on the sides for the wider opening but I was able to install the other gate on my own. Latches are easy to use and lock into place with a safety latch. Simple to use. If the safety latch could auto close upon closure of the gate, that would make it better, but other than that the gates are serving their purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Purchased to keep puppy to one part of house.
customer_reviews.text: Use all of the extensions, whenever someone catches the base on walking thru the gate it comes off and needs to be reset. Because we are using the extensions it is a bit of a process to reset. Very busy part of the house (that’s where the puppy is!) this reset needs to happen every couple of days. Needed a solution for and angled space and this will not solve, the tension pieces are smooth and wont hold on an angle. You can see from the picture I’ve had to jury rig it to be straight. I purchased the wrong item for my need, may be better in less use area but I would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Lunch lady

customer_reviews.title: Read this review before even thinking about purchasing the product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this gate from Regalo, thinking it would provide safety and security for my young child. Unfortunately it did neither. The "redesigned" latch is faulty and easily broke, making it completely useless as a sharp piece of plastic is exposed. My attempts to contact Regalo have been failures as they refuse to deal with me at all, denying the fact that the replacement parts (which I was actually even willing to pay for) are listed on their website. Pathetic customer service, shoddy product, I suggest looking elsewhere if you need a baby gate that will keep your child safe.
customer_reviews.author: Harley

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FIT
customer_reviews.text: I feel lucky because i read reviews on here that said it was too big or too small and wouldn't fit exactly right. I am lucky that it fit perfectly in our doorway. We did purchase the wall nanny to go with it since one side of the gate was going on a staircase post. When you are installing, i would recommend checking which way the door is going to open before tightening everything. We have another Regalo gate that opens both ways but this one only opens one way. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Initially was thought to be good. Updated review following original
customer_reviews.text: Great product. We use it for dogs not children but my sister recommended this particular one because she does use it for her children and said it's the only one her kids didn't destroy. *Update: We have had this gate for approximately 6 months. Used to keep dogs out of our livingroom and off furniture. We use it daily to go into the room. It is not abused or beaten on and the welding part on the door of the gate came apart. Will contact customer service tomorrow to see if they will replace the broken piece.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, someone at the manufacturer is not doing their job. I bought this brand new, only to realize that the latch is off center from the metal tube, rendering it near impossible to close. You can see in the picture that the metal tube is thicker up top then below, yet the latch only fits the bottom portion. I own 2 other Regalo gates and love them, but this one is a thorn in my side...it's was my 3 attempt! (Previous 2 where Amazon warehouse deals where someone again failed to do their job and sent defective products labeled as 'open box like new')
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Black

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: This looks very nice and fits my 48" stairway. It might not take much force from a dog since the gap is so wide. The latch is nice in that you can put a slide lock on it or just close it without the lock and it still closes properly. I had to put a metal spacer under the lower hinge on the door to prevent the bottom of the door from hitting the lower cross bar. When this happens you have to lift the door about a 1/4" in order to clear the bottom and close the door. So the spacer I taped under the hinge raises the door and makes it so much easier to operate.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Cheap...doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: We've had this gate for about a year and a half and it's not durable at all. First the bars broke on the extension for the gate, then the latch on the top broke. We used to have extra wide gate made by a different brand for our first and second child. Which lasted over 4 years. If we planned on having a third child we would have saved that one instead of buying this piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: chipskip05

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and looks nice
customer_reviews.text: Once you figure out which extension go on what end, it's fairly easy to install... easier with 2 people for sure. We used it to keep a big dog away from small ones, worked great. Granted the big dog wasn't pouncing on it, should stand up just find to a toddler. I love that it has a gate to open and walk through, I'm not very tall so stepping over a gate all the time wouldn't be fun. Since it's adjustable, we can move it to different hallways... that was a must.
customer_reviews.author: ~Astro~

customer_reviews.title: I like these gates, but the size doesn't work for all openings advertised
customer_reviews.text: My doorway is 42" which is well with in the size range for this gate. Sadly with the add on combinations this gate is always a little too big or too small. I can still make it work, but the spindles have to be out way more than the instillation guidelines state. It's not as secure as the other gates from this company that fit my other doorways properly. Still functional, but definitely can see some sagging. Don't buy is you need something that won't budge and your opening is 42".
customer_reviews.author: Bubbles

customer_reviews.title: Watch the installation video.
customer_reviews.text: This product is worth buying especially if you have little ones or pets you want to keep out of certain places. When you unbox you’ll notice there’s about 2 in of space from the handle to where it’s meant to spring on to. Don’t be alarmed it’s not a defect. Watch the video as the booklet instructions may not be clear. When you begin tightening, the handle will hook on. This product does what it’s intended for a decent price compared to other gates. The steel feels durable but the latch seems a bit flimsy. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: No this will not work for 59” doorways
customer_reviews.text: Bought this since many reviewers said it’ll fit for like 59” doorways. Well yes and no. It’ll stretch that long but barely. But it’s not usable at that size because the pressure mounts become extremely flimsy and the lightest pressure will cause it to fall down.... but for the right doorway width, this is awesome. So I ended up buying a four inch extension from the regalo website for under twenty bucks and now it’s super sturdy for my 59 inch doorway.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Josh

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy to Open/Close AND Easy to Secure without putting holes in the wall!
customer_reviews.text: VERY sturdy and it's so EASY to open one-handed while holding the baby! We got this to not only keep our baby in the right place, but to also keep the dog OUT. Since we are renting, we didn't want to put holes in the wall - and with this setup you can choose to anchor the "feet" with a screw or just use the tension bars. We did not screw it in, and it is working beautifully. My other son is nearly 9, and I was worried he would get frustrated with the gate, but it's so effortless to open/close that after one or two times, he is a pro!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Anten

customer_reviews.title: Terrible for kids
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble and install, but SUCK for kids/toddlers. Or anyone really. I barely bump into it and it falls over . I bought 2 so obviously spent $100+ an I’m pretty mad. I was hoping this would take away the headache of my 2 toddlers getting into the kitchen and a room, but it causes more of a headache because they knock them over all the time. Too much of a hassle to return. I opted for pressure mounts so I wouldn’t have to drill holes in the walls, but I wish I would have just gotten one where you do have to drill cause these do not work for kids no matter how tight you do them
customer_reviews.author: kambria123

customer_reviews.title: Good gate but challenging to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Once the gate is assembled it is perfect for my space and relatively sturdy. However, the directions are not very clear. I believed that in spite of measuring carefully before ordering the gate simply didn't fit my space. With all the extensions it was too wide and without one of the extensions it was too narrow. The directions really didn't offer any help, and I was on the verge of returning the gate when I found a video on YouTube that showed how to extend the tension screws. The company should invest in better technical writers. My rating is reflective of the poor documentation. If you buy this gate search for an installation video on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: FinChase

customer_reviews.title: So easy to open and close!
customer_reviews.text: The mechanisms on baby gates have come a long way! I've lost count of how many baby gates we have had over the years for both our kids and pets and this one is by far the easiest to open and close. Just lift the handle and it unlocks, drop it and it re-locks. We used if for a 52" opening and it fit perfectly. I had read some reviews which said it did not fit that width but they were incorrect, I believe they did not assemble it correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Canyon Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great! Been up almost 4 years
customer_reviews.text: We bought this gate for a French door opening, to be able to have the door open but keep baby out of the homeschool room. It lasted 3 years 10 months before the plastic on the handle broke. It no longer opens with the handle, but takes a second motion to slide the lock. I can't complain though, it has taken a lot of abuse from four kids (three boys who are convinced that the only way to close it is to hit it as hard as possible). It's been a good gate and I would buy it again if I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: R.E.S.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to open.
customer_reviews.text: Baby is 11 months old and figured out how to open it. Hard to install. Wobbly after installations, but didn’t come apart or anything. Now I’m out $50 and my baby is in the kitchen and I cannot even get a different door because this one is out of warranty/return period.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hassan

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and crooked.
customer_reviews.text: It's a suspension gate so it has to be pushed tight enough for the latch to work. But pushing the suspension that tight causes the gate to push itself crooked because it is so flimsy. Im pretty sure my toddler will break this gate by the end of the year. Also there is a huge gap with under one of the lips where the pieces attach. If I wasn't in such desperate need for this gate, I would go through the trouble of returning it. Just splurge and get a better quality gate.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Fit's a 54" space perfectly, Love this gate!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this gate to keep my wife with dementia from entering the kitchen where many dangers lie. Also to keep the 2 dogs out of the kitchen. Was easy to setup, real easy, and works perfectly. I worried about sturdiness but even when the dog jumps up on the gate it is solid. The opening was 54" and I've seen other reviews where they said this wouldn't fit but it did just fine. This gate has made my life much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Gerfnad

customer_reviews.title: It does the trick (sort of)
customer_reviews.text: It does the trick... sort of. After an hour of adjusting. We had a large opening and used every piece. But the gate is so wobbly. The door keeps hitting the bottom bar, and it's hard to get everything aligned so that the latch works properly, without needing to be forced into place. Definitely a lot of room for improvement. It does the trick (sort of) but it's a huge hassle. And it keeps sliding out of place no matter how tight I make it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Arend

customer_reviews.title: Works great. If you have a wide area to block ...
customer_reviews.text: Needed a gate to keep our 3 rescue dogs from rushing the front door when visitors come. Works great. If you have a wide area to block off you will need another person to help you set it up as the pieces come apart too easily. Once installed, it was wonderful and worked great for the purpose we purchased it. Much better than the wooden gate we were using that we had to step over all the time to enter the room - having the swing gate opening is a life saver!!!! Personally I would like a slightly larger width to the swing gate area but I've gotten use to angling my body as I pass through.
customer_reviews.author: P. PhelpsTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Set up simple & very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: We have a 3 month old Aussiedoodle that takes runing jumps at the gate and it hold up extremely well. He's about 20 pounds. Set up was quick and easy as we read the instructions. The gate pulls in as you install it do there is no gap. Having the doorway is very convenient. We installed it so the door opened toward the jumping dog so he doesn't accidently open it if we don't lock it. Would definitely buy it again!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get this one if you have non-std doorway opening and large breed pups.
customer_reviews.text: Has 3 extensions of varied length which really makes a difference in fitting non-std openings. Also, love the locking mechanism vs others. Had the small version of this gate in a std doorway, and another brand for the larger opening. That one was junk with only two ext, so it was either too small or too large for the opening. Also, their locking mechanism was more complex and sucked. Get this one.
customer_reviews.author: The Cap'n

customer_reviews.title: May not be sturdy enough when used for bigger spaces.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this gate specifically because of the length of the doorway I planned on putting it in (54inches). The problem with this gate is that it claims up to 56 inches, however when installed it barely reached each end of the walls. Also, the tensioners aren't threaded into the ends and it is not very sturdy even after tightening them and using the wall cups. I figured I would give it a try nonetheless, but when my dog leaned on it, it tilted. I returned this product and plan on finding a sturdier product for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Mama

customer_reviews.title: Keep them safe!
customer_reviews.text: With a little one at home, it is necessary to secure the exits so that they dont run away. This extra wide gate with attachments has the ability to fit into passageways and extend if required. The sung lock is secured enough so that kids dont fiddle with them. The only reason this is not 5 stars is - when you are outside, and if the bottom lock is on, it becomes a hassle to open it
customer_reviews.author: Rambo

customer_reviews.title: Best gate for babies and doggies
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this product, we have 2 at our home and I got one at my parents home. One has been up for years for the dogs, the new ones are for my daughter who just started crawling. Hands down best gate I've ever used at other peoples homes and mine. I guess the only critic I could give is that for what ever reason when we have guests over, people don't seem to understand how it works the first time they go to use it. Once you show them where the handle is and no issues at all. Maybe if the handle was a different color it would be more intuitive?
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Owe Noo

customer_reviews.title: My dog thinks I'm cool
customer_reviews.text: I am not an intelligent person, and I managed to put it together with minimum profanity. I am also childless (perhaps in part to the lack of intelligence) so I use it for my dog. This gate has survived many a Texas storm, and countless other dogs barking outside, so I would have to say it's at least sturdy-ish. However, I have heard that dogs are WAY different than kids, so I can't say if it would withstand a toddler tantrum
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase and it is sturdy... no regrets.
customer_reviews.text: works fabulous, i like that i don't have to mount to the wall. FYI the gate looks like it is bent but it is not you need to position it where you want it and then twist the round plastic tab so that it will close the gap. There is a yellow card attached to the packaging that advised of this which i ignored and sure was trying to bend it back into place till my son "read" the direction. lol..... Easy to open and close. my yorkie cannot get thru the bars and he is about 9-10 lbs he is a traditional sized yorkie... i got this and then purchased another.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly N.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but with a weak link
customer_reviews.text: This would be a much more solid product if the way it tighten to the walls was more substantial. It is 4 thin bolts with a rubber pad on the end, and they just aren't very durable. If you run into the gate (which is quite easy to do with groceries in hand), the bolts and their fittings bent quite easily. As long as you are gentle with it, the gate itself a nice product,. Considering that this is built to corral small children though, the durability factor of the fasteners is something to consider.
customer_reviews.author: JellyOrJam

customer_reviews.title: Great gate
customer_reviews.text: We got this to keep our 3 dogs sequestered in one area of the house. It is so great! It fits the space perfectly and the door is easy to open and close so we can go in and out easily. The dogs have jumped up on it a few times and it stays in place (my dogs are 30 lbs or less so I'm not sure how well it would keep a larger dog out). All in all we can't complain. It's been great to have.
customer_reviews.author: Capener

customer_reviews.title: Best option available in the market
customer_reviews.text: I used it for a 40” opening and it did fit perfectly for me. I didn’t drill into the walls. Pressure mounts are not sturdy but works. I have 15 months old twin girls and they are quite active. It moves when both of my daughters gang up on the gate and then I have to come and stop them. But still it is the best option available in the market. I have tried some options. This one did stand out last. It is super easy to install. No need to drill. One more good thing is that I can open it with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Praveen J.

customer_reviews.title: It's really great! Sturdy and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: It took me an hour to put this gate together. No, not because of the gate. Because I didn't read the obvious orange paper that said "yo...there's a gap and it isn't an issue. You just need to tighten it". Granted, it took my entire body weight to tighten it to the right spot. But once that part was obvious then... I had no issue with the gate. It's really great! Sturdy and easy to clean. 4 stars because it is difficult to tighten the bottom as much as the top.
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: Works, but painful to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This gate was such a pain to assemble. Like others have mentioned, the extensions made the gate either too large or too small for my 52” stair opening, so it didn’t fit. My handy-man husband tinkered with it for over an hour before deciding to trim the wall-mounting screws, and we were finally able to get it to fit after that. Once you can get it assembled it does a great job though- my 18 month old is pretty rough and shakes the gate all day trying to escape and it’s stayed in place.
customer_reviews.author: Kanders

customer_reviews.title: Works great but only complaint is that the door way is ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great but only complaint is that the door way is pretty small. Much smaller them other baby gates I have had. I do like it because the door will stay open so its good at night so the animals can go in and out and not have to prop it open like others that close automatically. But again the small door way is an issue when trying to carry laundry through. If I had known or probably read the dimensions before purchasing and putting it up I would of gotten a different one.
customer_reviews.author: K. Nadeau

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, sturdy gate
customer_reviews.text: Set up was easy. This is a high quality gate and looks great! I highly recommend this gate, especially with the entrance in and out. I had a previous gate that I had to climb over and trust me. It's just not fun, especially when it keeps falling down. I was having to put it back up to often. I opted for this gate and am so glad I did. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow, sufficed for the price until we found a replacement.
customer_reviews.text: We were not thrilled with this product, but worked until we found a replacement. Installation wasn't terrible, but product is still rather flimsy. Our biggest complaint was the width of the walk through. It was very narrow and we would constantly get caught trying to walk through the gate. My husband and I are very much average or below average in size and still found it to be too narrow. Since we used it to block off the kitchen, we had to walk through it frequently and found it to be more annoying than our other baby gates.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for angled walls
customer_reviews.text: We had 2 corner walls that we ended up securing with wooden blocks. The door requires tension to close properly. It only works if the gate is straight up which is hard to do with angled walls. We had to mount one corner differently so that the bottom is straight and allows the door to be closed without a gap. Let's hope this holds up when baby climbs up the gate.
customer_reviews.author: Cao

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I had a wider than normal opening and a lot of the standard gates would not fit. I bought this one even though it was more expensive than I wanted to pay. It fit perfectly and is adjustable on both the top and the bottom which is nice because of the baseboard. I like how the gate swings open. I'm not sure how easy it was to install, because when I came home from work, my 13 year hold already had it up. That means it is pretty easy.
customer_reviews.author: Cheercoach

customer_reviews.title: Great gate for keeping puppy out of mischief
customer_reviews.text: We just received this gate today. The set up was relatively easy, the directions could be more detailed, but it was fine. Technically out opening is 62 inches, so we simply added some foam to each of the pressure points. Because we are only using this to keep our puppy in a room, and not a child, we don't keep it locked, and therefor if very easy to open and close, but stays latched enough to keep the puppy (who is actually over a year old, but still behaves like a puppy) out. Overall, it seems like a good gate. Not the most attractive, but it was $50, and does its job.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Gate
customer_reviews.text: This gate is pretty good. I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because the knobs easily slide around, even with proper assembly. Although the material is fairly sturdy, the overall design doesn't lend itself to stability. I'm also not a fan of the white color, but the black option was far more expensive at the time of purchase. I do think it's pretty versatile and will fit a range of walk-throughs. It's also quite easy to assemble, in my opinion. Overall, a decent and affordable purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Narrow Opening, Eventually Need Two Hands To Open
customer_reviews.text: This gate opening is NARROW. It is just less than the span from my elbow to my finger tips (I'm 5'4''). And it's crotch height. I've clipped my baby's feet a few times. Also, in the most secure close mode the open mechanism becomes a two-handed job for me. It is however VERY sturdy. Metal is hard and supported. And my clever toddler has not figured out how to get through (she's 1.5 yrs). Overall I wouldn't do again.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy and good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality gate. I use it across my sliding glass doorway to keep my dogs in or out. Easy to install. Visually appealing. I installed it about 20 minutes and I'm not a builder. I don't have it screwed in or anything, just wedged in using the provided stoppers. Gate is easy to swing in and out and open as well to lock in place. Great value for the money. Very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica

customer_reviews.title: Meets our needs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to gate off our downstairs study that we turned into a playroom for our 6 month old. We wanted to keep our shedding dog out and our little crawler in. Our opening is 60 inches and it works perfectly. Does not leave dents or marks on the wood frame (we didnt use the screws). I am slightly concerned that when our daughter becomes a much stronger toddler she will be able to pull it down, but it serves it's purpose for the moment. If you buy this for a dog that is a jumper or hates barriers, this probably isn't going to hold up unless you screw the rod holders into the frame.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Secure for babies
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use between my family room and kitchen area due to my grandbaby. It was fairly easy to install with 2 pairs of hands. I did also purchase wall cups to prevent any damage to my wood trim.  The baby is a year old and can shake this gate without any movement. The latch is secure and once you've used it a time or two is easy to complete with one hand. I'd recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Beth McGarry

customer_reviews.title: Dog prison was fun while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: This is honestly probably perfect for babies. For dogs? No, not so much. It worked excellently for a couple weeks and then one of my dogs knocked it down with just her mass and it hasn't worked the same since. I can't get it tight enough to stay sturdy and still be able to open and shut easily. I have another of this model in a smaller size that has never had an issue. I think the larger you go the flimsier it gets. For reference the wall I have is 51" with one extender on either side of the entry/exit portion.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole B.

customer_reviews.title: Good gate for babies
customer_reviews.text: This gate was pretty easy to install. It’s easy to take on and off as well. You have to pull a latch lift up and then open the gate so it’s difficult for little ones to open. Although my 2 year watched enough times to know how to do it now. My 1 year old is still held back it though. It is somewhat wobbly if you don’t get it perfect though. Overall good product.
customer_reviews.author: Nik Martin

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for keeping the puppy off the carpet and giving the toddlers a break from him. I like that the lock isn't hard to open like other similar baby gates where you have to squeeze and push down. My 2 and 4 year old can easily operate the door so they don't need me to open and close it for them 100 times a day. Our opening is 48" wide so we used the extenders and it fits great. There is an optional second latch on the bottom that wouldn't be so easy for a toddler to operate if you don't want them opening the door. So far I'm really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: tori bell

customer_reviews.title: deceptive description
customer_reviews.text: i purchased the 54" gate, but i needed 60". the description says also included are extensions of 4, 8, and 12 inches. yes, included to equal 54". i do not think the wording was clear. also came without instructions and some of us need those. it had pictures saying looks like this before assembly and like this after assembly. how about some simple instructions so no guessing is necessary. at this point i would be happy to buy an extra extension, but that is only possible for the extra tall gate
customer_reviews.author: jeanne mccready

customer_reviews.title: Well made gates not exactly custom
customer_reviews.text: Needed these gates for small dog. Said it would fit 59 inch wide but you had to extend the Brackets out so far but it seemed very Unstable ,on one gate we are at had to buy an extension That worked much better but in another area the extension was too much and couldn’t fit it in. All in all the gates are excellent as long as you don’t put too much weight on it
customer_reviews.author: Tararizona

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and expandable. We got this to keep our new puppy contained, until he got potty trained. If you are using this for a dog, any dog under 5 lbs can go through some of the bars. But a simple pool noodle cut into a small length and spit up a side, will take care of that.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes

customer_reviews.title: WILL fit space wider than 56 inches!
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving this four stars instead of five for dishonesty. The description says it fits up to 56 inches, but it will fit a wider space by an inch or two. I have a 57” space and almost spent more money for the wider gate, but then decided I could just make it work with something on the end. However, when we put it together, we realized it was already wider than advertised. So don’t buy the bigger gate if your space is close to 56”.
customer_reviews.author: Mrssusan

customer_reviews.title: 1 week and already broken.
customer_reviews.text: Apparently my 14 month old has super human strength or this thing is shoddy. He apparently was able to snap the connection where the gate connects. The issue is now when the gate is open it can just be pulled off and there is sharp metal. Will be returning and looking for something else. Initial assembly and install was easy. The other issue we found is since it is multiple pieces it flexes a lot when pushed upon.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Well made, durable, sturdy, hard to open with one hand when fully latched.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these to keep my dog constrained to the mud room. The gates are well made and durable. Usually I don't press the latch all the way down because it's difficult to unlock and open with one hand, but I love them all the same. I'm using two; one, without extensions, in a standard 30-inch doorway and the other, with two 12-inch extensions, in a 51-inch passageway. Both are quite sturdy and adequate to control the dog (and larger dogs when they visit). But my 3-year-old granddaughter can open them even when latched.
customer_reviews.author: glennrp

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Sturdy fence with latch door
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for my hallway that is 53” wide. Since this fence goes up to 58” I did not need to use the last extension but nice to have if I ever need it. It’s very sturdy, it holds onto the wall very well even with baseboards. The door latch is very easy to open but still baby proof. Instructions were easy to follow. I’m very happy I picked this up.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond V.

customer_reviews.title: nice item. quick delivery
customer_reviews.text: nice item. quick delivery. I'm embarrassed to say I was a bit baffled by the apparent gap at the gate closure even though I read the paper that explained it. I found the paper again as I was about to give up on it. it is true that as you get it installed, the pressure puts the gate in the correct position. no holes in the wall required. it stays in place very well. My 20 month old grandson was able to open it after watching me once but I got a clamp out and put it around the locking mechanism so he can't raise it. Works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to open
customer_reviews.text: Returned this item. When the gate is properly tension mounted (with enough tension that it doesn’t move when pulled) the gate can’t open. There’s not enough space for the shorter plastic bit to get by the metal frame. Perhaps this was a particular defect in our gate that’s not common, I won’t be testing out this style again though.
customer_reviews.author: Lux

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Gate!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best things I bought last year. I have a huge front porch and a small shi-tzu so I bought this gate to keep her on the porch & its a perfect fit & the opening is pretty large, but this gate works fantastic and its so sturdy,no rust after a year in the weather! Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good gate unless you receive a defective one. Bad customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this exact gate twice. The first time it was great, I loved it, so I bought a second one. The second one is defective and does not hold sturdy in the wall opening (a baby can easily pull it down). I did not discover this until the exchange/return window was closed so I reached out to the manufacturer, who refused to do anything about it. Not impressed with the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really well made gate that has stood the test of time (and a toddler).
customer_reviews.text: Great gate! We've had this gate up in our hallway for over a year now. It was simple to install (we used extensions to fit) and we've had no issues. My 2 year old now throws the occasional tantrum and pulls with all his might on the gate (until we remove him) and the gate hasn't budged. It's super easy to open with one hand but has enough to it that my son isn't able to open it himself (I think he's figured out how it works but the lever you have to push to the side is too much for his little hands yet - which is a good thing!). Great gate!
customer_reviews.author: Em Small

customer_reviews.title: Nice big gate.
customer_reviews.text: I am using for a German Shepherd puppy for the past few weeks. So far so good. I wish it was a little more sturdy but I do understand that I have it open to the max. I’m happy I got it, I think I’d be going crazy if the pup was all over the house. I am assuming that if she starts jumping on it when she gets another month or 2 of weight& height on her it possibly may not hold up..but I don’t know what would..Lol.. these things can only be expected to take so much force.
customer_reviews.author: H.S.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the baby out
customer_reviews.text: The door to my bathroom always stays open cause of my cats waterbowl and needed something to stop my wild baby from constantly wondering into the forbidden area he really wanted to get to so finding the gate that fits almost perfect into the large walkway was a great find. All the other options were either to small or just to big so im happy for this one. It was easy to install and my daughter is able to still figure out how to go in and out of it and shes 3 so great product nice and sturdy and so happy I was able to find this.
customer_reviews.author: Denise garcia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Solution for our house
customer_reviews.text: We needed a gate to prevent our puppy from getting back to the carpeted rooms in our house (the majority of our house is wood). This gate is awesome! It comes with three different extension panels to ensure that the gate fits perfect. You can even put the extension panels together. I love that you can’t tell that these are extension panels once they are up. The slats are small so nothing (puppy or child can squeeze through. The gate is easy open and close but would be difficult for a baby to get open. I loved how easy it was to assemble! I love this gate!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: Garbage Gate and Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: This is junk. To begin with the bottom screw stripped out. Now it just spins without being able to get it back out. Secondly, In order to tighten the top enough to be safe for a child to not pull down it puts pressure on the top of the gate and it jams. It can not open. I’m past the return date. I just lost my money.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, but it doesn’t feel as sturdy as I hoped it would, and the gate latch is very simple to operate. It’ll do for now since my daughter isn’t walking yet, but I’m sure she will figure out how to open it in a matter of minutes once she can reach, assuming she hasn’t yanked it apart first.
customer_reviews.author: Bronwyn Herr

customer_reviews.title: Extra end caps would have helped with our slightly smaller opening. May purchase some.
customer_reviews.text: For our purposes, the gate is fine. It's a replacement for the same brand that broke, purchased 3 years ago. It's sturdy enough, but as mentioned, end caps would keep it tight at the door. One of my dogs can pop the door open with his paw. What wears the gate out more quickly is large dogs jumping up and trying to get past the gate. This is working for us.
customer_reviews.author: doublemint47

customer_reviews.title: SAFETY HAZARD!!!
customer_reviews.text: Accident waiting to happen! I bought this for my little maltese-pomeranian mix (really small puppy), but I wouldn't even trust this with my dog. The product is made of cheap flimsy metal. No quality at all! There are sharp edges on wielding points. The gate rattles and made of cheap hard plastic with plenty of small parts that easily comes off (choking hazard for small children). The locking mechanism for the gate has plenty of pinching hazards for curious toddlers. My worst purchase on amazon. Whoever sells this product should go to jail for children endangerment. Did I already say I wouldn’t even trust my dog with it? This purchase is on it’s way back for refund.
customer_reviews.author: ian

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad gate. Hard to find a tall one that ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad gate. Hard to find a tall one that would fit this area. Only issue is that it doesn’t actually fit this area easily and the side pieces need to be out really far for it to fit. Sadly my dog can get through it still a good gate. Had some difficulty getting the door to shut but when you’re putting it up make sure you tighten all sections good!
customer_reviews.author: Christina R.

customer_reviews.title: Still working after 4 years of daily use!
customer_reviews.text: Still working after 4 years of daily use! I have bought appliances that lasted less than that. I use it to keep a small toy breed dog on one end of the house. People with larger animals or growing children pushing on it may have different outcomes.
customer_reviews.author: K. E. Bowden

customer_reviews.title: Husband got it together & it works
customer_reviews.text: We got this to keep our little human out of the kitchen, and while he may hate it, I love it. It is super study and love the gate feature, so I don't constantly have to straddle the gate to get over to get to the kitchen. My husband had a bit of a fit putting it together, but he got over it and it works!
customer_reviews.author: cheryl stoyke

customer_reviews.title: Great if all pieces fit:(
customer_reviews.text: The extension pieces do not all line up. My larges section can not be inserted anywhere. This is the piece I need. I am trying to make do with the other pieces, but the parts that provide tension on wall are maxed out. This causes wobbling and strain. This is the 3rd gate I bought for the bottom of my stairs. I had finally got something semi-workable even though less desirable and I’m tired of returning gates. It would be super easy to install, but I spent over an hour trying to bend the steel rod to line up. My mistake...it is thick steel and unbendable. I was trying to be optimistic.
customer_reviews.author: Njm

customer_reviews.title: Don't overdo it.
customer_reviews.text: It functions to keep our little dog out of where she gets in trouble. The extensions could use longer, better fitting pins to prevent the whole thing from bending if over tightened, and to keep it from falling apart when removed. I currently use zip ties to hold it together when removing it get large items through.
customer_reviews.author: JLIrish

customer_reviews.title: FOR PET GATE REVIEW!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Based on the high reviews i felt this was going to be a homerun. This is by far the worst gate I have ever purchased. It is extremely wobbly. The pins for the gate extensions do not line up. The bars are bent and scratched up and the welds are horrible. I'm a handyman so it was installed correctly. 10 minutes after I installed it my 12-pound dog was able to push it over. Don't waste your money. I purchased the regalo 1175 and had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Salbooch

customer_reviews.title: it was easy to add the extensions and actually you can add ...
customer_reviews.text: my new rescue dog was jumping on the front door of our old home and scratching up the door. Also ripping the screen when we left the door open. WE have several of these gates in our home to corral the dogs as needed when repair man come or to keep them out of the cat food... it was easy to add the extensions and actually you can add more that come with the smaller size as needed as well, which I did not realize. easy to walk through and can open with one hand if needed.
customer_reviews.author: April J. Knapp Maron

customer_reviews.title: PIECE OF TRASH, NO CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: Was really good for the first month then we bumped into it once and now it’s messed up. Not easy to install. Reached out to customer service and they said it was my problem to deal with via Amazon. For $60 I would hope for more. Do not buy this. Now we are stuck with a landfill item that we will have to purchase from a different brand again rather than company fixing it.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Does what it supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I don't use to write reviews but this one deserves it. The installation is really easy. I needed to cover a 55" wide, worked perfectly. I used wall anchors and fasteners for a better support. Also, an additional stairs pole attachment.
customer_reviews.author: P7b7

customer_reviews.title: Durable & Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: I got this to keep the baby from trying to climb our stairs. It was pretty easy to install and looks good. I was surprised at how sturdy it is just from the pressure mount. I didn't have to screw anything into the wall (though you would want to if you were installing this at the top of the stairs). The gate is easy to open and close. And somehow my cat can even squeeze through - I have no idea how she fits...
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Wilson

customer_reviews.title: The littles cannot climb it as there are no horizontal cross bars like there are on the wooden pressure ones
customer_reviews.text: My daughter bought a different gate on here, but ours is by far more solid and well built! This gate can withstand 3 large 70 pound dogs with their feet up on it, trying to get to daddy when he comes home! The littles cannot climb it as there are no horizontal cross bars like there are on the wooden pressure ones. I wish the gate was a bit wider as we are not a skinny family, but its just barely wide enough. If you have to move anything past it that is wider than about 2 feet, you will have to go up and over the gate.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria L McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Mounted this at the base of our steps to prevent Danger and Mayhem from climbing up the steps. Came with extensions that can make it wider so it fit perfectly across the stairwell. Both of them at 25lbs a piece can get to tugging it on at same time. So far, it does budge. As for extra wide... it is a good thing, carrying 2 boys through the gates I need just a touch more space. I recommend getting one set at least of the wall pads that spread some of the pressure across the wall, it increases the grip and surface contact area for the mounts.
customer_reviews.author: Average Jim

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your little one out of spaces
customer_reviews.text: It was tricky in the beginning because of the molding I have on the bottle but I managed to figure it out. I opted out of using the little holder piece to screw into the wall because I rent an apartment.. but I absolutely love it! It keeps my 1 year old from running to the back and interrupting my son while distance learning! Totally recommend!
customer_reviews.author: _quaner

product_meta.title: Regalo 56-Inch Extra WideSpan Walk Through Baby Gate, Includes 4-Inch, 8-Inch and 12-Inch Extension, 4 Pack of Pressure Mounts and 4 Pack of Wall Cups and Mounting Kit
product_meta.description:
Your baby has started to walk, it’s time to child proof your house. The WideSpan gate hits all the criteria with an all-steel construction, installs quickly by either pressure mount or wall mount and is adjustable to accommodate door openings between 29-56 inches wide. Space between the bars are 2.5 inches. The gate door is 16 inches wide. Please Read • The gate WILL appear BENT before installation • There WILL be a GAP at the handle before installation • Both of these concerns will be eliminated once the gate is properly installed in your doorway • Please measure your opening prior to purchase to ensure proper fit Regalo 56-Inch Wide Span Baby Gate Features • Fits openings between 29-56 inches wide and stands 30 inches tall • Easy to use lever handle features a one-touch release safety lock • Convenient walk through design • Easy pressure mount set up • Made for children 6-24 months • Can be used for medium to large dogs What’s Included in The Box • One Regalo 56-inch WideSpan Baby Gate • Instruction Manual • One 4, 8 and 12-inch extension kit • Four pressure mounted spindle rods • Four wall cups with screws

BRAND STORY
By

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Wide or narrow openings this one fits them ALL. Introducing the Regalo Extra Wide WIDESPAN safety gate. This sturdy, all metal walk-thru gate accommodates a variety of openings ranging from 29 inches to 56 inches. No need to purchase extra extensions this gate includes a 4, 8, and 12 extension kits. Gate height is 30 inches. The easy to adjust pressure mounting system makes installation quick and easy. When your hands are full the convenient one-hand walk thru design makes your job a little easier. The Regalo WIDESPAN meets all current safety standards. Great for pets too. You will notice a slight gap between the gate door latch and the frame. This is not a defect. Your gate is a pressure mounted gate and this gap will disappear once you tighten your gate in its opening.

MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
We offer customer support at 952-435-1080 or service@regalo-baby.com to assist in any additional customer needs or assist in set up.

See more
feature_bullets: EXTRA WIDE: Expands to fit openings between 29-56 inches wide. Stands 30 inches tall. NOTE: please be sure measure your opening prior to purchase to ensure proper fit.

EASY TO USE AND SET UP: Pressure mount design that is quick to set up. Please note, before installation there will be a gap between the gate latch and the frame which is NOT a defect and it is NOT bent. This gap will be eliminated once installed. US BASED CUSTOMER CARE, call us between 9am CST and 4pm CST Monday through Friday to answer your questions at 1-866-272-5274.

ADJUSTABLE: Includes a 4, 8 AND 12-inch wide extension kit and 4 pressure mount spindle rods. Perfect for doorway, hallway and bottom of stair use. Gate can quickly be removed out of the opening for easy storage.
SAFETY CERTIFIED: Includes multiple safety-lock features, four wall cups for added security and mounting hardware. Perfect for children 6-24 months. Great for PETS TOO
DURABLE AND CONVENIENT: The all steel design is durable and convenient with a walk-through door. Certified to both JPMA and ASTM standards. Sturdy construction

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars5,398 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
